Two mothers and two daughters went out to eat, everyone ate one slice of pizza, but only three slices were eaten. How is this possible?
What begins and has no end, and is the end of all that begins?
What has cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and water but no fish?
What has a ring but no finger?
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks?
I am not alive but grow; I don’t have lungs but need air; I don’t have a mouth but water kills me. What am I?
I go up and down the stairs without moving. What am I?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters?
What English word retains its pronunciation even after you take away four of its five letters?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What am I?
If you multiply me by any other number, the answer will always be the same. What number am I?
If you have me you want to share me; if you share me you don’t have me. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I have four legs in the morning, two at noon, and three in the evening. What am I?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
There’s a one-story house in which everything is yellow. What color are the stairs?
